column4: hi: did any of you have the problem with 7.10 server that it freezes with ubuntu server hangs  openbsd secure shell server's configuration sshd
not that I recall, but 7.10 is no longer supported anyway. 8.04 would be a good upgrade.
sure.. but all my data is on that box

I don't understand what the problem is... you don't have backups or you haven't ever done an upgrade before? the upgrade will not damage your data, if you do it right (and the instructions are very precise, so it's hard to do it wrong)
It is a Server right... the last backup is three days old, I cannot boot into the box to rescue the data
I still don't see the problem. can you elaborate?
Ok its a bit complicated... still in the main
just skip the details and get down to the nitty-gritty :)
for instance: WHY can't you boot the box into rescue mode? What's preventing that?
alright, can you boot into a livecd on the new machine?
Until  openbsd secure shell server's configuration sshd
does it just freeze, or..?
yes
tried ctrl-c?
yes
gotcha... what sort of difference between the main hardware now from what it was attached to then?
yeah, it *should* work just fine like that... I don't know, going to a p3 like that... could be a bios setting is off
or maybe the hd cable is a little lossy on this one
you could also try pci=routeirq if you haven't already
I will try that... check back later
cheers
Thanks
